attributes.action: Investigate methods used to smuggle Nazi War Criminals to UK and to investigate whether there was identity theft using GP Death registration malpractices
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In 1972 there were two sudden deaths.  Matron Mary McGill, volunteer Matron at the HQ Care Home and family home of Leonard Cheshire and Sue Ryder.

A Regional Crime Squad Detective sergeant from Wales who was investigating suspected aliens registration and GP death registration practices in UK charity care homes.

After the PRO release two years ago about MI6 falsifying death certification in order to recruit the Nazi war criminal Horst Kopkow ...Did "Impeccable Intelligence sources" brief specialist journalists that there were grounds to agree the suspicions of Regional Crime Squad in 1972 and of the Police constable Coroners Officer for Matron McGill Decd.

Matron McGill had formed suspicions about "The distance kept between the admin and nursing sides of the homes".

The RCS Det sgt  formed suspicions that identity theft may have been occurring via death registration malpractice.


Should the suicide verdicts handed down on Matron McGill and the Det sgt now be reviewed by a Judicial Inquiry ?

Minnesota Protocol ... Minimum standards of sudden death inquiry where Government Involvement is suspected.
